tutorial.title: Creating Grid Rows
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to set individual grid rows

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
CSS Grid gives us control over rows like adjusting their size and location inside a grid.

To see this in action, hit the buttons to create two grid rows and move the grid item.

lessons.title: Grid Rows Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's take a closer look at how to size rows first. We use the grid-template-rows property to define grid rows.

Make sure to pick grid-template-rows.

lessons.title: Pixel Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
To place grid items in rows of fixed sizes, we use pixel units. If there are fewer grid items than rows, we'll get empty rows.

Make sure to pick 50px, followed by 50px, and finally 50px.

lessons.title: Percentage Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can also use percentage values for rows, but this only works if the container has a set size, like 300px in this case. Code 60%.

Make sure to type 60%.

lessons.title: Fractional Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can combine px units and fr units together if we need to. Set the grid rows to 100px 1fr 2fr.

Make sure to pick 100px, followed by 1fr, and finally 2fr.

lessons.title: Auto Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Setting the row size to auto will make the row take up as much space as there is available. Code auto to see.

Make sure to type auto.

lessons.title: Repeat Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
Like before, we can use the repeat() function to write less. Code repeat(3, 40px).

Make sure to pick repeat followed by ( and then 3,, 40px, ).

lessons.title: Question: Grid Rows Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which property defines grid rows?

grid-template-rowsgrid-rows

Make sure to pick grid-template-rows.

lessons.title: Question: Percentage Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid items does this container have?

Three grid itemsFour grid items

Three grid items.

lessons.title: Question: Fractional
lessons.interactiveContent:
How many grid rows have their height defined in the .grid-container CSS selector?

Three grid rowsFour grid rows

Three grid rows.

lessons.title: Question: Auto Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

A row that's 30px tall and another that fills up the rest of the containerTwo rows of equal size

A row that's 30px tall and another that fills up the rest of the container.

lessons.title: Question: Auto Value II
lessons.interactiveContent:
Keeping in mind that the grid container doesn't have a height property set, what does this code display?

Two rows that are only as tall as their contentA small row followed by a tall row

Two rows that are only as tall as their content.

lessons.title: Example: Grid Rows Property
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code grid-template-rows: property to create three rows of 50px each.

Make sure to pick grid followed by - and then template, -, rows.

lessons.title: Example: Pixel Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create three grid rows using 50px 50px 50px.

Make sure to type 50px 50px 50px.

lessons.title: Example: Percentage Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the grid row values so that the first one is the smallest and the last one the biggest.

Make sure to pick 20%, followed by 30%, and finally 50%.

lessons.title: Example: Fractional Units
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the grid row values so that the first one is the smallest and the last one the biggest.

Make sure to pick 1fr, followed by 2fr, and finally 3fr.

lessons.title: Example: Auto Value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code auto auto auto to make the grid items default to the size of their content.

Make sure to type auto auto auto.

lessons.title: Example: Repeat Function
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create three rows that have their height set to auto with the repeat() function.

Make sure to pick repeat followed by ( and then 3,, auto, ).
